trans-unit.source: Provides a way to apply a sort expression to an <xref href="System.Linq.IQueryable"></xref> object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression> class is used in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.QueryExtender> control to sort data in ascending or descending order.
The sorting is performed by the default comparer for the type of the element.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.QueryExtender> control supports a variety of options that you can use to filter data.
After you use the filter options, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression> object to sort the data.
You specify the data field to sort by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression.DataField%2A> property.
You specify the sort direction by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression.Direction%2A> property.

After the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression> object has been applied to the data source, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.ThenBy> expressions to perform a subsequent sort on another data field.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression"></xref> class.
Gets or sets the property of the <xref href="System.Linq.IQueryable"></xref> object to sort by.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression> object sorts the data in a data field.
Subsequent sort operation can be performed on a different data field by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression.ThenByExpressions%2A> property.
The property of the <xref href="System.Linq.IQueryable"></xref> data source object to sort by.
Gets and sets the sort direction of the <xref href="System.Linq.IQueryable"></xref> data source object.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression> class is used in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.QueryExtender> control to sort data in ascending or descending order.
The direction of the sort operation is specified by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression.Direction%2A> property.
The sort direction of the data source object.

Applies a sort expression to an <xref href="System.Linq.IQueryable"></xref> object based on a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression.DataField"></xref> value and a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression.Direction"></xref> value.
Specifies the data source to apply the sort to.
An instance of the data source that the expression was applied to.

Gets or sets the collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.ThenBy"></xref> expressions to apply after an <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression"></xref> value is applied to the data source.

After a sort operation is performed by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression> in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.QueryExtender> control, subsequent sort operations can be performed by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression.ThenByExpressions%2A> property.

The collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.ThenBy"></xref> expressions to apply after the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Expressions.OrderByExpression"></xref> is applied to the data source.
